metadata.title: CVE-2018-20856 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 4.18.7. Inblock/blk-core.c, there is an __blk_drain_queue() use-after-free because acertain error case is mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1054.58
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
